posts.author: jfarrow
posts.post_text: October 20, 2017 at 3:39 PM#6This may be related to selective effects versus template effects.If you use a template effect to create playback data in an executor, the effect data becomes absolute (no reference to the original template). So if you use a macro to change the template, your executor doesn't contain a reference to the newly updated form in your template.If instead you use a selective effect, the executor references the effect pool each time the effect is called; so modifications by your macro to the effects pool will be reflected in playback.
